title: Microinteractions in UI Design
excerpt: Enhancing user experience through small, engaging interactions.
content:
Microinteractions are small, subtle animations or feedback mechanisms that enhance the user experience by providing context, guiding users through a process, or simply adding delight.

Types of Microinteractions

  • System status feedback
  • User input confirmation
  • Call-to-action enhancements
  • Data visualization animations

Best Practices

  1. Keep animations subtle and purposeful
  2. Ensure microinteractions are fast and smooth
  3. Use microinteractions to provide immediate feedback
  4. Make sure they enhance rather than distract from the main experience
  5. Consider the frequency of interaction when designing microinteractions
  6. Ensure accessibility by providing alternatives for users who prefer reduced motion
